{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marine Engineer II",
  "description": "Habrams Energy offers you engineering, procurement, construction management, operations, and maintenance services for oil &amp; gas projects in the Gulf of Guinea. We provide specialist solutions to international oil companies, marginal field operators, and service companies.

Our work ranges from retrofitting and de-bottlenecking to designing complete facilities &acirc;&euro;&ldquo; with seamless transition from construction to operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Marine Engineer II

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Main Functions


	Evaluate and comment on discipline engineering work performed both internally and by Contractors and subcontractors to ensure that work is being executed in accordance with Company specifications, Company standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Facilitates effective execution of discipline engineering and design routines that align with the team&#39;s goals, objectives, and procedures.
	Assures accurate and timely communication among the team and other company Functions on discipline engineering activities, progress, and issues.
	In addition to technical ability, they should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.


Tasks and Responsibilities
In addition to all Level 1 tasks and responsibilities, a Level 2:


	Design and oversee testing, installation, and repair of marine apparatus and equipment.
	&nbsp;Conduct analytical, environmental, operational, or performance studies in order to develop designs for products, such as marine engines, equipment, and structures.
	&nbsp;Prepare, or direct the preparation of, product or system layouts and detailed drawings and schematics.
	Evaluate the operation of marine equipment during acceptance testing and shakedown cruises.
	Analyze data in order to determine the feasibility of product proposals.
	&nbsp; Confer with research personnel in order to clarify or resolve problems, and to develop or modify designs.
	&nbsp; Investigate and observe tests on machinery and equipment for compliance with standards.
	Conduct environmental, operational, or performance tests on marine machinery and equipment.
	Determine conditions under which tests are to be conducted, as well as sequences and phases of test operations.
	Maintain and coordinate the repair of marine machinery and equipment for installation on vessels.
	Inspect marine equipment and machinery in order to draw up work requests and job specifications.
	Review work requests and compare them with previous work completed on ships in order to ensure that costs are economically sound.


Skills and&nbsp;Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marine or Civil Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience
	Strong knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria
	Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities
	Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of software programs
	Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;applications to:&nbsp;hesprojectrecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-29",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-30",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Habrams Energy"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189560"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Marine Engineer II Job at Habrams Energy




        
    

        
        Habrams Energy offers you engineering, procurement, construction management, operations, and maintenance services for oil & gas projects in the Gulf of Guinea. We provide specialist solutions to international oil companies, marginal field operators, and service companies.

Our work ranges from retrofitting and de-bottlenecking to designing complete facilities â€“ with seamless transition from construction to operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marine Engineer II

Job Location: Lagos

Main Functions
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Evaluate and comment on discipline engineering work performed both internally and by Contractors and subcontractors to ensure that work is being executed in accordance with Company specifications, Company standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Facilitates effective execution of discipline engineering and design routines that align with the team's goals, objectives, and procedures.
	Assures accurate and timely communication among the team and other company Functions on discipline engineering activities, progress, and issues.
	In addition to technical ability, they should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.


Tasks and Responsibilities
In addition to all Level 1 tasks and responsibilities, a Level 2:


	Design and oversee testing, installation, and repair of marine apparatus and equipment.
	 Conduct analytical, environmental, operational, or performance studies in order to develop designs for products, such as marine engines, equipment, and structures.
	 Prepare, or direct the preparation of, product or system layouts and detailed drawings and schematics.
	Evaluate the operation of marine equipment during acceptance testing and shakedown cruises.
	Analyze data in order to determine the feasibility of product proposals.
	  Confer with research personnel in order to clarify or resolve problems, and to develop or modify designs.
	  Investigate and observe tests on machinery and equipment for compliance with standards.
	Conduct environmental, operational, or performance tests on marine machinery and equipment.
	Determine conditions under which tests are to be conducted, as well as sequences and phases of test operations.
	Maintain and coordinate the repair of marine machinery and equipment for installation on vessels.
	Inspect marine equipment and machinery in order to draw up work requests and job specifications.
	Review work requests and compare them with previous work completed on ships in order to ensure that costs are economically sound.


Skills and Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marine or Civil Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience
	Strong knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria
	Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities
	Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of software programs
	Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: hesprojectrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist",
  "description": "Brilliant Performance Solutions Limited -&nbsp;Our client operates a top-notch Hotel in Ikeja GRA, Lagos. Due to increasing activities, they are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;GRA, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Functional Responsibilities
Your duties shall include, but not be limited to, the following:


	Check in and check out guests according to the company standards.
	Advise guests on room features/utilities / local amenities.
	Provide excellent customer service at all times and deal with all calls &amp; emails efficiently and effectively.
	Liaise with all Managers on any issues and concerns.
	Inputting high-volume reservations correctly and noting any special requests.
	Promoting and upselling the property&rsquo;s facilities &ndash; be a brand ambassador for the property.
	Ensuring billing is correctly carried out to the hotel&#39;s standards.
	Making bookings and cancellations, usually by phone, email or face-to-face and recording the information on a computer.
	Answering questions about hotel facilities and about local transport, places of interest and entertainment.
	Using sales skills to promote additional hotel services and facilities.
	Dealing with special requests, such as room service, taxi bookings or wake-up calls.
	Passing on messages to guests and taking mail for posting.
	Passing on any guests&#39; problems to the appropriate member of staff.
	Greet, welcome, and check in new guests.
	Inform guests of policies during the check-in process.
	Verify guests&rsquo; payment methods.
	Deliver room keys, give guests directions to their rooms.
	Maintain records of guest room bookings.
	Compute guests&rsquo; bills and post charges.
	Accommodate guests with extra pillows, cots, and toiletries.
	Send messages to guests.
	Create incident reports, daily activity logs, or other documents requested by management.
	Book and schedule conference rooms.
	Help with administrative and clerical tasks as needed.
	Maintain a positive attitude at all times.
	Help guests access the internet and WIFI.
	Enforce hotel rules and regulations.
	Alert management of any wrongdoing or guest misconduct.
	Report emergencies to the authorities.
	Keep an orderly front desk and reception area.
	Any other assignment.


Requirements


	The ideal person must be a graduate in any relevant field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in the front office of a reputable and standard Hotel.
	A certificate in the Hospitality Industry and knowledge of hotel operational hospitality software for the front office will be an advantage.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;bphotjobs@gmail.com&nbsp;or&nbsp;jobmasters2020@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Receptionist Job at Brilliant Performance Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Brilliant Performance Solutions Limited - Our client operates a top-notch Hotel in Ikeja GRA, Lagos. Due to increasing activities, they are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: GRA, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Functional Responsibilities
Your duties shall include, but not be limited to, the following:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Check in and check out guests according to the company standards.
	Advise guests on room features/utilities / local amenities.
	Provide excellent customer service at all times and deal with all calls & emails efficiently and effectively.
	Liaise with all Managers on any issues and concerns.
	Inputting high-volume reservations correctly and noting any special requests.
	Promoting and upselling the property’s facilities – be a brand ambassador for the property.
	Ensuring billing is correctly carried out to the hotel's standards.
	Making bookings and cancellations, usually by phone, email or face-to-face and recording the information on a computer.
	Answering questions about hotel facilities and about local transport, places of interest and entertainment.
	Using sales skills to promote additional hotel services and facilities.
	Dealing with special requests, such as room service, taxi bookings or wake-up calls.
	Passing on messages to guests and taking mail for posting.
	Passing on any guests' problems to the appropriate member of staff.
	Greet, welcome, and check in new guests.
	Inform guests of policies during the check-in process.
	Verify guests’ payment methods.
	Deliver room keys, give guests directions to their rooms.
	Maintain records of guest room bookings.
	Compute guests’ bills and post charges.
	Accommodate guests with extra pillows, cots, and toiletries.
	Send messages to guests.
	Create incident reports, daily activity logs, or other documents requested by management.
	Book and schedule conference rooms.
	Help with administrative and clerical tasks as needed.
	Maintain a positive attitude at all times.
	Help guests access the internet and WIFI.
	Enforce hotel rules and regulations.
	Alert management of any wrongdoing or guest misconduct.
	Report emergencies to the authorities.
	Keep an orderly front desk and reception area.
	Any other assignment.


Requirements


	The ideal person must be a graduate in any relevant field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in the front office of a reputable and standard Hotel.
	A certificate in the Hospitality Industry and knowledge of hotel operational hospitality software for the front office will be an advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bphotjobs@gmail.com or jobmasters2020@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Bwosh is an interior company. We are bent on providing exceptional designs and excellent execution processes through the lens of our client&rsquo;s needs and wants with the drive to deliver exquisite products and services. We have experience majorly in residential development as well as office restructuring.

Our scope of services cuts across fresh builds and renovation works. Our strength has continued to be in the high quality of the services we offer and the integrity we bring into the discharge of our services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager / Content Creator

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented Social Media and Content Creator to join BWOSH Advance Limited.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing engaging visual and written content that reflects our brand identity, promotes our interior design projects, and grows our online presence across various social media platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, create, and manage content for BWOSH Interiors&rsquo; social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, Facebook, etc).
	Develop and execute monthly content calendars in alignment with marketing and brand goals.
	Capture and edit high-quality photos and videos of interior projects, behind-the-scenes, and company events.
	Write engaging captions, articles, and promotional copy tailored to each platform.
	Monitor social media trends, audience engagement, and competitor activities to optimize performance.
	Collaborate with the design and project teams to showcase completed works and ongoing projects.
	Analyze and report on content performance metrics to guide future strategy.
	Ensure brand consistency across all visual and written communication


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, or a related field.
	1&ndash;2years of experience in social media management, digital marketing, or content creation (experience in the interior design or lifestyle industry is an advantage).
	Proficiency in content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, etc.).
	Strong photography and video editing skills.
	Excellent communication and storytelling abilities.
	Creative eye for aesthetics and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV &amp; portfolio to:&nbsp;hrbwosh@gmail.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Application &ndash; Social Media and Content Creator&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

Social Media Manager / Content Creator Job at Bwosh




        
    

        
        Bwosh is an interior company. We are bent on providing exceptional designs and excellent execution processes through the lens of our client’s needs and wants with the drive to deliver exquisite products and services. We have experience majorly in residential development as well as office restructuring.

Our scope of services cuts across fresh builds and renovation works. Our strength has continued to be in the high quality of the services we offer and the integrity we bring into the discharge of our services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager / Content Creator

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented Social Media and Content Creator to join BWOSH Advance Limited.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing engaging visual and written content that reflects our brand identity, promotes our interior design projects, and grows our online presence across various social media platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, create, and manage content for BWOSH Interiors’ social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, Facebook, etc).
	Develop and execute monthly content calendars in alignment with marketing and brand goals.
	Capture and edit high-quality photos and videos of interior projects, behind-the-scenes, and company events.
	Write engaging captions, articles, and promotional copy tailored to each platform.
	Monitor social media trends, audience engagement, and competitor activities to optimize performance.
	Collaborate with the design and project teams to showcase completed works and ongoing projects.
	Analyze and report on content performance metrics to guide future strategy.
	Ensure brand consistency across all visual and written communication


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, or a related field.
	1–2years of experience in social media management, digital marketing, or content creation (experience in the interior design or lifestyle industry is an advantage).
	Proficiency in content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, etc.).
	Strong photography and video editing skills.
	Excellent communication and storytelling abilities.
	Creative eye for aesthetics and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV & portfolio to: hrbwosh@gmail.com using “Application – Social Media and Content Creator” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance & Administrative Officer",
  "description": "Havilah Strategies and Consult was founded on the belief that challenges are not obstacles but opportunities waiting to be unlocked.&nbsp;We are a team of passionate experts committed to transforming organizations in the healthcare, education, and business sectors. We bring years of collective experience to every project, helping our clients overcome challenges and achieve sustainable success.

What started as a vision to make a difference has grown into a consultancy firm dedicated to delivering tailored, impactful solutions that foster growth, efficiency, and progress.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance &amp; Administrative Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

Job Details


	The Finance &amp; Administrative Officer will play a central role in ensuring smooth financial operations and efficient administrative management across projects and internal functions.
	You&rsquo;ll manage financial reporting, budgeting, procurement, and office administration &mdash; ensuring&nbsp;compliance, accountability, and operational excellence that enables our team to deliver impact at&nbsp;scale.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (max 2 pages) and a 1-page Cover Letter (200 words) to:&nbsp;Career@havilahstrategies.com&nbsp;using &quot;Finance &amp; Administrative Officer - (Your Name) as the subject of the email.",

Finance & Administrative Officer Job at Havilah Strategies and Consult




        
    

        
        Havilah Strategies and Consult was founded on the belief that challenges are not obstacles but opportunities waiting to be unlocked. We are a team of passionate experts committed to transforming organizations in the healthcare, education, and business sectors. We bring years of collective experience to every project, helping our clients overcome challenges and achieve sustainable success.

What started as a vision to make a difference has grown into a consultancy firm dedicated to delivering tailored, impactful solutions that foster growth, efficiency, and progress.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Administrative Officer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Nigeria

Job Details


	The Finance & Administrative Officer will play a central role in ensuring smooth financial operations and efficient administrative management across projects and internal functions.
	You’ll manage financial reporting, budgeting, procurement, and office administration — ensuring compliance, accountability, and operational excellence that enables our team to deliver impact at scale.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (max 2 pages) and a 1-page Cover Letter (200 words) to: Career@havilahstrategies.com using "Finance & Administrative Officer - (Your Name) as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Business Partner",
  "description": "Erudite Consulting is a Recruitment firm established in April, 2020. Erudite Consulting has been immensely successful in sourcing for the right candidate to be in an organization team. Keeping pace with organization framework and being on the look for the extremely talented individuals has become ever more challenging. Here is where Erudite Consulting comes into play to bring the best suited talent for your company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Business Partner
Job Location:&nbsp;Ekiti&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) serves as a strategic partner to business leaders, providing expert HR guidance and implementing people strategies that align with the organization&rsquo;s goals.
	The HRBP will drive initiatives across performance management, employee engagement, workforce planning, learning &amp; development, and employee relations to ensure a high-performing and engaged workforce.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Partnership:


	Partner with business leaders to identify workforce needs and provide HR solutions that support business objectives.
	Participate in business strategy sessions to align HR initiatives with departmental goals.
	Provide insights and recommendations based on HR metrics, data analytics, and employee feedback.


Employee Relations &amp; Engagement:


	Serve as the first point of contact for employee concerns and guide policies, procedures, and grievance handling.
	Champion initiatives that promote a positive and inclusive workplace culture.
	Drive employee engagement surveys, analyze feedback, and support the implementation of improvement action plans.


Recruitment &amp; Workforce Planning:


	Collaborate with the Talent Acquisition team to ensure timely sourcing and onboarding of quality hires.
	Monitor staff movement, turnover trends, and proactively manage manpower gaps.
	Support manpower budgeting and workforce analytics for business units.


Performance and Reward:


	Guideline managers through the performance appraisal process, ensuring fairness and compliance with policy.
	Support implementation of compensation and benefits programs that motivate and retain top talent.
	Conduct salary and benefits benchmarking in collaboration with the Compensation &amp; Benefits (C&amp;B) team.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in human resources, Industrial Relations, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2&ndash;4 years of progressive HR experience
	Professional certification is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of employment laws, HR analytics, and business strategy alignment.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and negotiation abilities.
	Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
	Sound knowledge of HR best practices and policies.
	High level of confidentiality, integrity, and emotional intelligence.
	Proficiency in HRIS tools and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N541,000 &ndash; N680,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date
5th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hiremenow78@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and location as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Human Resources Business Partner Job at Erudite Consulting




        
    

        
        Erudite Consulting is a Recruitment firm established in April, 2020. Erudite Consulting has been immensely successful in sourcing for the right candidate to be in an organization team. Keeping pace with organization framework and being on the look for the extremely talented individuals has become ever more challenging. Here is where Erudite Consulting comes into play to bring the best suited talent for your company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Business Partner
Job Location: Ekiti 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) serves as a strategic partner to business leaders, providing expert HR guidance and implementing people strategies that align with the organization’s goals.
	The HRBP will drive initiatives across performance management, employee engagement, workforce planning, learning & development, and employee relations to ensure a high-performing and engaged workforce.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Partnership:


	Partner with business leaders to identify workforce needs and provide HR solutions that support business objectives.
	Participate in business strategy sessions to align HR initiatives with departmental goals.
	Provide insights and recommendations based on HR metrics, data analytics, and employee feedback.


Employee Relations & Engagement:


	Serve as the first point of contact for employee concerns and guide policies, procedures, and grievance handling.
	Champion initiatives that promote a positive and inclusive workplace culture.
	Drive employee engagement surveys, analyze feedback, and support the implementation of improvement action plans.


Recruitment & Workforce Planning:


	Collaborate with the Talent Acquisition team to ensure timely sourcing and onboarding of quality hires.
	Monitor staff movement, turnover trends, and proactively manage manpower gaps.
	Support manpower budgeting and workforce analytics for business units.


Performance and Reward:


	Guideline managers through the performance appraisal process, ensuring fairness and compliance with policy.
	Support implementation of compensation and benefits programs that motivate and retain top talent.
	Conduct salary and benefits benchmarking in collaboration with the Compensation & Benefits (C&B) team.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Industrial Relations, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2–4 years of progressive HR experience
	Professional certification is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of employment laws, HR analytics, and business strategy alignment.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and negotiation abilities.
	Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
	Sound knowledge of HR best practices and policies.
	High level of confidentiality, integrity, and emotional intelligence.
	Proficiency in HRIS tools and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N541,000 – N680,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date
5th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hiremenow78@gmail.com using the Job Position and location as the subject of the email.
